title: West Ham v Sheffield United betting odds: Blades are looking sharp
text:
Sheffield United, buoyed by their win against Arsenal, travel to West Ham, who are looking to end a two-game Premier League losing streak

United fighting fit

At the start of the season Sheffield United were the bookies’ favourite to head straight back down to the Championship.

But after picking up seven points from a possible 12, they are now just 11/4 with Paddy Power to be relegated.

The Blades have kept three clean sheets in their last four games, including during the recent home win against Arsenal.

The 1-0 victory against the Gunners was the most impressive of the season for Chris Wilder’s team and suggests they are more than capable of fighting for a mid-table finish.

Paddy Power have Sheffield United to repeat Monday night’s 1-0 scoreline at 12/1.

West Ham quality to shine through

West Ham’s brilliant start to the season had some pundits backing them to challenge for the top six.

Back-to-back defeats at the hands of Crystal Palace and Everton has seen the hype subside but the bubble hasn’t burst for the Hammers just yet.

Manager Manuel Pellegrini has an extremely talented squad and with the Hammers level on 12 points with Sheffield United, a win would see them climb back into the top six reckoning.

Paddy Power have West Ham to win at 11/10.

Don’t expect goals galore

West Ham may have been on a two-game losing streak but neither of the defeats was a thrashing.

Everton’s second goal in their 2-0 win came in injury time and Crystal Palace edged the Hammers 2-1 with a last-gasp winner, which shows both games were tight.

Sheffield United have been hard to break down and away from home they set up well defensively.

The Blades’ last trip down south saw them draw 0-0 with Watford and they will be happy with a similar result at the London Stadium.

Meanwhile, West Ham will aim to avoid prolonging their losing streak, with Paddy Power offering 12/5 for a draw and Under 2.5 Goals at 10/11.
description: Betting preview as Sheffield United, buoyed by their win against Arsenal, travel to West Ham, who are looking to end a two-game Premier League losing streak.
